Ctrl+K

User Guide#

galah.atlas_counts(taxa=None, filters=None, group_by=None, expand=True, separate=False, verbose=False, use_data_profile=False)#

Used for getting the number of occurrence records before you’re ready to download the actual occurrences.

To know how many total records are in your chosen atlas, type

import galah
galah.atlas_counts()

which returns

   totalRecords
0     112637772

example of filters that can be used: “year=2020”,”basisOfRecord=HUMAN_OBSERVATION” example of group_by groups that can be used: “year”,”basisOfRecord”

galah.atlas_media(taxa=None, filters=None, fields=None, verbose=False, multimedia=None, assertions=None, use_data_profile=False, collect=False, path=None)#

Used for getting media, such as images, videos and sounds. An example query (filtering to ensure a small nunber of results) is

import galah
filters = ["year=2020","decimalLongitude>153.0"]
galah.atlas_media(taxa="Ornithorhynchus anatinus",filters=filters)

which returns

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/buy003/opt/anaconda3/envs/py39/lib/python3.9/site-packages/galah-1.0.0-py3.9.egg/galah/atlas_media.py", line 163, in atlas_media
    if "|" in m:
TypeError: argument of type 'float' is not iterable
https://biocache-ws.ala.org.au/ws/occurrences/offline/download?email=amanda.buyan@csiro.au&dwcHeaders=True&emailNotify=false&disableAllQualityfilters=true&&qa=none&fields=decimalLatitude%2CdecimalLongitude%2CeventDate%2CscientificName%2CtaxonConceptID%2CrecordID%2CdataResourceName%2CoccurrenceStatus%2Cmultimedia%2Cmultimedialicense%2Cimages%2Cvideos%2Csounds%2C&&fq=year:(2020)&fq=decimalLongitude:[153.0%20TO%20*]%20AND%20-(decimalLongitude:"153.0")&fq=%28lsid%3Ahttps%3A//biodiversity.org.au/afd/taxa/ac61fd14-4950-4566-b384-304bd99ca75f%29&
<Response [200]>
galah.atlas_occurrences(taxa=None, filters=None, test=False, verbose=False, fields=None, assertions=None, use_data_profile=False)#

Used for getting occurrence data for your species. To get occurrences for

To know how many total records are in your chosen atlas, type

import galah
galah.atlas_occurrences(taxa="Vulpes vulpes")

which returns

galah.atlas_species(taxa=None, verbose=False)#

Used for getting occurrence data for your species. To get occurrences for

To know how many total records are in your chosen atlas, type

import galah
galah.atlas_species(taxa="Heleioporus")

which returns

galah.galah_config(email=None, email_notify=None, atlas=None, data_profile=None)#

Use to set defaults for galah to use. To run this to configure your email, type

import galah
galah.galah.galah_config(email="yourname@example.com")
galah.galah_filter(filters, ifgroupBy=False)#

This takes

To know how many total records are in your chosen atlas, type

import galah
galah.galah_filter(filters="year=2020")

which returns

&fq=year:(2020)
galah.galah_group_by(URL, group_by=None, filters=None, expand=True, verbose=False)#

Used for grouping counts by a specific query, i.e. “year” or “basisOfRecord”. It’s mainly utilized in atlas_counts.

galah.galah_select(selectionList=None)#
galah.search_all(assertions=None, atlases=None, apis=None, collections=None, datasets=None, fields=None, licences=None, lists=None, profiles=None, providers=None, reasons=None, ranks=None, column_name=None)#

Used for getting and searching various amounts of information about the chosen atlas you want to get counts and occurrences from.

To find a list of collections in the apis you want to search, type

import galah
galah.search_all(apis="collections")

which returns

Empty DataFrame
Columns: [atlas, system, api_name, api_url, called_by]
Index: []
galah.search_taxa(taxa)#

Used for getting the taxonConceptID for querying the Atlas. To get a table with the taxon concept ID, type

import galah
galah.search_taxa(taxa="Vulpes vulpes")

which returns

  scientificName  ...     rank
0  Vulpes vulpes  ...  species

[1 rows x 4 columns]
galah.search_values(field=None, value=None, column_name=None)#

Used for getting the values from a field you want to query. To see how this is used, type

import galah
galah.search_values(field="basisOfRecord",value="OBS")

which returns

           field             category
2  basisOfRecord          OBSERVATION
0  basisOfRecord    HUMAN_OBSERVATION
4  basisOfRecord  MACHINE_OBSERVATION
galah.show_all(assertions=False, atlases=False, apis=False, collections=False, datasets=False, fields=False, licences=False, lists=False, profiles=False, providers=False, ranks=False, reasons=False)#

Used for getting various amounts of information about the chosen atlas you want to get occurrences from.

To find out what datasets are in your atlas, type

import galah
galah.show_all(datasets=True)

which returns

                                                    name  ...      uid
0                 River Torrens Linear Park Species List  ...  dr14140
1                                 Warringah Species List  ...   dr4047
2                               'A Genome' Oryza species  ...   dr8221
3                                              *Brigalow  ...  dr14507
4                                                0662409  ...  dr19938
...                                                  ...  ...      ...
12109  [C4OC] Torres Strait Regional Landcare Facilit...  ...   dr3529
12110  [C4OC] Traditional Ecological Knowledge Record...  ...   dr3199
12111  [C4OC] Trialling and demonstrating farmer inno...  ...   dr3519
12112                [C4OC] Urban and Coastal Protection  ...   dr6802
12113        _River_Torrens_Linear_Park_Species_List.csv  ...  dr19265

[12114 rows x 3 columns]
galah.show_values(field=None)#

Used for getting the values from a field you want to query. To see how this is used, type

import galah
galah.show_values(field="basisOfRecord")

which returns

           field             category
0  basisOfRecord    HUMAN_OBSERVATION
1  basisOfRecord   PRESERVED_SPECIMEN
2  basisOfRecord          OBSERVATION
3  basisOfRecord           OCCURRENCE
4  basisOfRecord  MACHINE_OBSERVATION
5  basisOfRecord      MATERIAL_SAMPLE
6  basisOfRecord      LIVING_SPECIMEN
7  basisOfRecord    MATERIAL_CITATION
8  basisOfRecord      FOSSIL_SPECIMEN
